column1: Lipase is a protein (enzyme) released by the pancreas into the small intestine.
This test is used to measure the amount of the lipase in the blood.
This test is done to check for disease of the pancreas, most often acute pancreatitis.
Lipase appears in the blood when the pancreas is damaged.

Higher-than-normal levels may be due to: - Blockage of the bowel (bowel obstruction) - Celiac disease - Duodenal ulcer - Cancer of the pancreas - Infection or swelling of the pancreas This test may also be done for familial lipoprotein lipase deficiency.
